Sentencas: Pastes of ceramic particles are used in many industrial applications such as in printed electronic products and solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing

Sentencas: Ethyl cellulose (EC), a polymer component in the paste, is very useful to control the rheological properties of the pastes for screen printing.
Titulo: Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing

Sentencas: In this study, to prepare ceramic La0.6Sr0.4Ti0.3Fe0.7O3-delta (LSTF) pastes, EC was mixed with an organic solvent, ethylene glycol monobutyl ether acetate, and LSTF powder.
Titulo: Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing

Sentencas: The effects of EC and LSTF particle contents were investigated on the rheological properties of the pastes, using shear, stress, frequency-dependence, and a 3-step recovery tests.
Titulo: Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing

Sentencas: The recovery ratio of the pastes in the 3-step tests was found to depend strongly on their EC and LSTF particle contents, decreasing at higher contents due to the formation of a strong network.
Titulo: Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing

Sentencas: We also investigated the microstructure and surfaces of thick films fabricated through screen-printing, and confirmed that pastes with a low recovery ratio and high viscosity afford smooth surface profiles.
Titulo: Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing
Rheological analysis of ceramic pastes with ethyl cellulose for screen-printing
